title: A2327A - Teaching Fellow
text:
Job Ref: 82692 
Applications are invited for an enthusiastic and highly motivated Teaching Fellow based within the Health Economics team in the Institute. You will assist with the running of/teaching on a number of health economics modules and support the development of a new MSc Programme, coordinate interns placed with the team and an external seminar series, as well as deliver on an agreed programme of research. 
You will have an honours degree in Health Economics or a related discipline, plus a PhD or equivalent postgraduate professional qualification or experience, with some teaching experience. 
You will have excellent organisational, communication and interpersonal skills and demonstrable capacity to work in a range of education settings and situations. You will also meet deadlines and manage conflicting priorities working flexibly and cooperatively with others. 
This post is tenable for 2 years. 
Further information can be obtained by contacting Professor Luke Vale (via janice.legge@ncl.ac.uk ) 
The Institute of Health & Society is committed to supporting equality and diversity for all staff and students. Applications for part time/flexible working will be considered; please state your desired working arrangements in your application. 
The Institute holds a silver Athena SWAN award in addition to the Universityâ€™s bronze Athena SWAN award in recognition of our good employment practices for women working in science, and the HR Excellence in Research award.
